topic.title: Current limitations of ZeroNet API and project's activity
topic.body:
Hi, what are the current limitations of ZeroNet API? I had a quick glance at it already and it seemed full featured enough, but I can't help but wonder why there are no complex apps like markets already available? Is everything already in place to create such applications but no one tried making a public market yet or is something still missing in the API that's preventing commerce from coming over to ZeroNet? Or perhaps I just haven't found any yet? 

Last thing, I noticed there isn't much activity on the project's main repository, is the project lacking in maintainers?

1_1HN54tqPZqnHs5SpJVFVsMhRH1nUSt3iQF.body:
> [o4zw5vmpoz5hz78z](#comment_101_1KTjPe9MxoYkcXj78GuZgCcj3R3f3Twh7r): what is the main repo?
> checkout the http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit about updates to zeronet

https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet

> [o4zw5vmpoz5hz78z](#comment_102_1KTjPe9MxoYkcXj78GuZgCcj3R3f3Twh7r): mhh looks good to me https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/graphs/contributors

Yea it seems the project has many contributors, however the commit frequency is rather low for a project of this size. Isn't it?

https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/pulse/monthly

> [nofish](#comment_331_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): I think the API is ready for a public market. There is currently only one developer of the project (me). I usually tests new features for some days before commiting to public, so the commits will contain many thing at once.
> There is also many other, ZeroNet related repositories I contributing to (sites, docs): https://github.com/HelloZeroNet?tab=activity

Oh I see, well I guess its pretty good for a single developer! Are you actively trying to attract more core maintainers but you can't find any?
